page.title: 20COMBE ESTATE 2 R MARKER
page.content: A large area of the estate is let to the Forestry Commission and a thriving shoot is leased out to a syndicate, but apart from this Mr. Marker takes an active role in the maintenance of the houses and those woodlands not let. The estate is maintained by the rents from the properties which are used for upkeep and repairs but this does not allow for any unexpected capital expenditure. In the past land has had to be sold but now the potential of the village is being developed without losing final control of the properties. A group of derelict farm buildings is at present being converted into residential units and craft workshops and the woodlands are being brought into correct management. All this work must proceed slowly and much thought to conserve what is best in the area.
